CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters

CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters Struct Reference

#include <Apoxi/AddOns/CodecManager/CodecDevice.hpp>


Data Fields

UINT16 m_actual_height
UINT16 m_actual_width
UINT32 m_application_category

UINT16 m_frame_rate_numerator
UINT16 m_quality_level
UINT32 m_timer_resolution

Detailed Description

Video encoder parameters passed to the video encoder.
See also:
VideoEncoder::SetConfig

Field Documentation

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters::m_actual_height
 

Actual height of the video (in pixels).

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters::m_actual_width
 

Actual width of the video (in pixels).

UINT32 CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters::m_application_category
 

The application category that is making use of the video encoder (see CodecDevice::ApplicationCategoriesFlagsType). In dependency of this parameter (and the m_quality_level parameter) the actual parameters (like SceneCutDetection, Preprocessing level, rate control model) of the video encoder are set.

UINT32 CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters::m_bit_rate
 

Bit rate (in bits/sec).

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters::m_frame_rate_denominator
 

Denominator of the frame rate (in frames per second). The actual frame rate is calculated as m_frame_rate_numerator/m_frame_rate_denominator.

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters::m_frame_rate_numerator
 

Numerator of the frame rate (in frames per second). The actual frame rate is calculated as m_frame_rate_numerator/m_frame_rate_denominator.

UINT16 CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters::m_quality_level
 

Quality level. In dependency of this parameter (and the m_application_category parameter) the actual parameters (like SceneCutDetection, Preprocessing level, rate control model) of the video encoder are set. The higher this value the better the encoding quality. 0 corresponds to default settings. If the value is greater than the maximum supported quality level (which can be retrieved via CodecManager::GetVideoEncoderCapabilities), the maximum level is set.

UINT32 CodecDevice::VideoEncoderParameters::m_timer_resolution
 

Resolution of the timer being used to calculate the time stamps. This value denotes number of primary time units per one second.
